Reviews.Title: “beautifull hotel”
Reviews.Author: lots65
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the All Angelo in april for 7 nights, well worth the money. Our room was very big and spacious and we had a lovely view of the bell tower. The staff were more then helpful, they were a lovely group of people. I would highly recommend this hotel to any one who is going to Venice id like to say a big thank you to Elizabeth Marcello and Massi as they were all so wonderful to us thank you so much .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week at All'Angelo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelx2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the week of March 18th in Venice staying at the All' Angelo. We booked through our local travel agent are were very pleased with the accommodations. We had a clean, spacious, quiet room #508 with a view of the canal. The staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially when it came to directions and transportation. The breakfast was delicious. I enjoyed my lattes every morning and my daughter loved her hot chocolate. We were celebrating my daughter's 18th birthday, and on our first day, one of the staff sang Happy Birthday when we sat down in the breakfast room. The staff was very attentive at breakfast keeping the buffet replenished and the tables cleared and set for the next diners. The hotel was immacuIate. A lot of attention was paid to keeping it clean. I enjoyed the different art work in the hotel and actually spent some time looking at it on all the floors. Venice is an old city so I did not expect or want to stay in a modern hotel. I would stay at the All' Angelo again and would recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Flapjack005
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, located right in the centre of Venice and a very short stroll to St Mark's Square. On arrival, the receptionist was very helpful and we were able to check in a couple of hours earlier than expected, which was appreciated after the early rise to travel. The room was also upgraded, overlooking the canal. The room itself, was ok, slightly smallish, but this didn't matter, as how long are you going to spend in your hotel room when there is Venice to explore on your doorstep?! The bathroom was lovely, very modern, nicely tiled and the shower was excellent - the actual shower cubicle was massive! If you do have a room with a canal view, don't expect it to be quiet in the mornings, there is always something going on outside, as everything happens by boat - whether it is a grocery/flower delivery or even building maintenance. But at least a refreshing change from not having to see cars or buses! The lift was out of order when we arrived, but we only had hand-luggage and only located 2 floors up, so wasn't an inconvenience. We also had a complimentary bottle of Prosecco left in our room, after a day out, which was a nice surprise. We are still unsure what the 'sorry for the inconvenience' was for? Can only assume it was for the lift? Anyway, we drank it and it went down very nicely. The breakfast was sufficient - various cereals, cheese, eggs, bacon, yoghurts, breads and loads of CAKES!! Shame there wasn't a toaster, but we got around that. The coffee and juice wasn't very good, which was a disappointment for Italy. We sampled the Happy Hour (between 6pm and 7pm) A great idea to have some snacks provided whilst you have a drink. The Barmen were very hospitable and friendly. But to sum up - all the staff were very friendly - would definitely recommend this hotel - so get booking!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Let us be clear, This is a 1 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mzamar
Reviews.Content: I am writing you from my small hard bed in my tiny, shabby and worn room at the All'Angeslo. This hotel was booked as part of a tour I am on and not chosen by me. Though sold to us as 4 star accommodation, the room's furnishings are a beaten up desk and chair, two tattered and chipped bed tables, and about 1 foot of space around two nearly touching twin beds. Location is excellent, staff is very good, breakfast very good, but our room, and the rooms of others in our group, are of youth hostel quality. No temperature control, run down furnishings,13" TV, a phone from the 80's. A decent one star hotel, but a truly awful 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great personal!”
Reviews.Author: luanaswensson
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel all'Angelo during a weekend in the Carnaval this year. It was a very nice experience! The location was perfect! It is really two steps from Piazza San Marco and I could not wish better. The personal very nice and helpful. The breakfast was very good to the Italian standards. I would certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “great spot. right off St Marco. good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: sparkyIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Unhelpful desk. Room 108, shabby shower room, noise and smells from restaurant below. Good housekeeping, good breakfast. Nothing else on site. Great central spot. Booked with BA. Great flight, good deal.

Reviews.Title: “will meet your needs....”
Reviews.Author: Laurie A
Reviews.Content: not exactly what one would expect for Four stars but the location was unbeatable. The room was outdated and a bit shabby as others have indicated but it was clean and met our needs! we had a canal view and plenty of room between the bedroom and sitting room and the bathroom was large. We were in 506.... High enough off canal...noise was not a problem at all! staff was fine (nothing to gush about) we'd recommend skipping the restaurant all together. plenty of great wine and food right out the door!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - Not worthy of 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Ana655
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel All'Angelo was a complete disappointment for the following reasons: - Breakfast was revolting, after the 1st morning although breakfast was included in the room rate we opted to eat out. Consisted of cold fatty bacon, oddly coloured scrambled eggs, foam textured bread rolls and a selection of poor quality cakes. - Dirty and old furnishings both in the room and public areas - Room had a strong smell of smoke despite being non-smoking - Poorly maintained eg. old and damaged furniture, lift malfunctioned - No umbrellas - No English language TV Channels apart from MTV, I do not think it would be too much to ask to have at least an English news channel available so that one can keep up to date with what is happening in the world! The central location is the only plus point of the hotel. Needless to say I shall not be repeating the mistake of staying at Hotel All'Angelo or either of the other two group hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not perfect, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TheMakkions
Reviews.Content: The best feature is by far the position, being the hotel in the heart of Venice - 1 minute walk from San Marco square. It's on a canal with its own dock (very nice scenery). The hotel itself is good but not exceptional, clean but a bit old. Also breakfast is not memorabile, served in a small room on the first floor. Anyway, the overall experience was quite good and I wouldn't mind recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay in a delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyDunn
Reviews.Content: A delightful stay in a delightful hotel extremely conveniently situated within a few minutes walking distance of the Piazza San Marco and the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: hatchetts_totton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the All'Angelo for two nights before joining a cruise. The room was large and comfortable, the bathroom was enormous with lovely hot fluffy towels. The breakfast was more than 'continental' with eggs, bacon, pastries,cereal,yoghurts and fresh fruit. The dining room was large enough to make it comfortable. The staff, with their excellent Engish were at all times helpful and courtious. The All'Angelo is well placed, just two streets back from St Marks square. Our room smelled slightly smokey even though we booked a non-smoking room. Only a minor point, otherwise an enjoyable stay. Ken and Maureen Hatchett, Totton UK

Reviews.Title: “Very Venice !”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with another couple from England. All 4 of us were delightfully satisfied with our accommodations. We were fortunate enough to get a room with a canal view that was simply wonderful. The breakfast buffet was terrific.. lots of variety and plenty to eat with attentive hostesses. Rooms are a tad smaller than we're used to but thought the All 'Angelo was an extremely good bargain with an enviable location just steps from St. Mark's Square. The Front Desk was spot-on in their recommendations for eateries and very pleasant no matter the request.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: rudge38
Reviews.Content: For us the All Angelo was a great place to stay for three nights in Venice. Unbeknowns to us we were given a roomy appartment a few feet away from the hotel very nice and comfortable. The hotel has a dock. The staff at reception and the breakfast room were always happy, friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was very good except the coffee machine. For us It realy is a great base to explore Venice, especially the San Marco vercinity, plenty of choice in bars and eateries close by and all around. The Angelo's bar was a nice place to recoup and relax after a busy day. Thanks All Angelo for a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sarah r
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel's location is ideally central, it is badly in need of redecoration. Our rooms had such thin walls we could hear our neighbours arguing, snoring and setting their alarms! The bathroom had cracked floor tiles, the sink leaked and the shower had no curtain or screen so the room was constantly flooded. In the bedroom, drawers didn't shut, curtains didn't pull and plaster was peeling off the walls. The staff were surly and the breakfast too basic. You have to queue for a coffee and the scrambled eggs were cold.

Reviews.Title: “Touring in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ChestnutPA
Reviews.Content: During our two week tour of Italy our group spent two nights at the Allâ€™Angelo in Venice. Its location is excellentâ€”only a five minute walk to Piazza San Marco and surrounded by restaurants and shopping. The hotel entrance is in a very narrow walkway so thankfully we had our tour guide to lead us there. Interestingly enough there was a Hellâ€™s Kitchen Wine Bar directly off the lobby. The hotel has a canal entrance that was used for service, baggage handling for tours and water taxi pick up. Our room was pretty dated (more than just the building being hundreds of years old) but was clean. The bathroom was updated but very tiny. It had a toilet and bidet which faced each other with only about eight inches clearance between the two. They had to be passed to reach the shower. We were on the fifth floor and I would say our room technically did not have a view but we could see out over the tiled rooftops to the clock tower in the piazza and the dome of St. Marks. That was achieved by leaning out the window and looking left. I had heard some horror stories about lack of air conditioning at the hotel prior to our visit but we didnâ€™t have that problem at all. The buffet breakfast was typical if you didnâ€™t count the eggs or bacon which were very underdone. The breakfast room was nice but very small for the amount of people in our group who always showed up at once because of tour or bus schedules. Great hotel for location but would check other places if we went back for better ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: pondock
Reviews.Content: found the hotel very good, we had a lovely room (509) and the breakfast was good if at times a bit crowded. On arrival was given a voucher for the restaurant with 20% discount,we sat at restaurant street table and ordered the tourist menu (18.50 euros each) and a bottle of wine then was told we had to move inside as outside tables were just a la carte, very embarrasing! this should be stated clearly on tourist menu which was posted outside, and the meal was the worst we ate in Venice, on paying the bill they would not accept discount voucher as that was just for a la carte, what a mess!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jackie56003
Reviews.Content: By far this was the best hotel we stayed at in Italy. It felt like a five-star luxury hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly. Our room (#507) was large, and had a canal view. The breakfast was generous and not crowded at all. Also, the location was very nice. Only about a two minute walk to St. Mark's Piazza. Only disappointment was that wifi only worked in the lobby. Overall, a great experience at All' Angelo!

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: yello815
Reviews.Content: This place was easily the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. We arrived late, and the directions were terrible. The hotel is not on San Marco itself, but in a back alley that was hard to find. When we asked others for assistance, no one seemed to know where the hotel was and were actually pretty rude about it. When we finally arrived however, we received keys to a 5th floor room which was tiny, old, dirty, and disgusting. I had heard that hotel standards in Italy were not of the same standard as those anywhere else, but I was not ready for what we saw. As soon as we checked in, we found roaches in the room. The furniture was falling apart and the bathroom was tiny and not exactly what I would consider clean. Showering for anyone over 100 lbs would be impossible and the floor flooded if you even tried. We were switched to a 2 bedroom apartment across the alley the next day, which reminded me of the exorcist movies. The furniture once again was falling apart at the seams, but it was a welcome change compared to the first room. Overall, I would give it maybe a 1 star in comparison to other hotel standards. The only saving grace was that one of the front desk guys (the late afternoon shift) was very kind to our travel partners when her luggage was lost and she needed assistance in calling the airport. I can't say the other front desk folks were as kind. Also, the waterboat entrance had a lovely view which made Venice seem surreal and all the more enchanting. Be forewarned though, if you arrive after midnight, the hotel recommends that you hire a private water taxi (100 euro for the trip!). You can alternatively take a bus that is right outside of the airport to the public waterbus dock and then board the waterbus for 22 Euros. From there, it is a 10 minute walk to San Marco. Go to the very end of San Marco and go down the last alley, and there you will find All Angelo if you are arriving by foot. Overall though, I would not recommend this hotel. I was terrified of sleeping there and heard scurrying all night. If you HAVE to stay in Venice, be prepared. I heard all of the hotels were of similar quality...

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel and even worse service.”
Reviews.Author: Cataplexy95060
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel as part of a tour group of approximately 30 people. Upon our arrival we were informed that the A/C had broken that day and would be fixed later that evening. We understood that sometimes things break and were content to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and tough it out until then; no hotel could have been less deserving of our tolerance. We discovered after a brief conversation with other patrons that the A/C had in fact been broken for THREE DAYS prior to our arrival and that the hotel management had purposely withheld this information from our tour company to ensure that we would no find other accommodations elsewhere. Moreover, as conditions continued to worsten at the hotel (the broken A/C being the tip of the iceberg), te hotel management insisted to upset patrons that no other hotels had openings and flatly refused to help find other accommodations. Keep in mind that temperatures in Venice at this time averaged 40 degrees Celsius, as such a lack of A/C is not merely a small discomfort. The hotel was not even gracious enough to apologize and offer fans to patrons; instead they responded with, and I quote: "worse things have happened"..."Americans are spoiled"... And "we cannot be expected to produce fans for everyone". In short the hotel management's reactions to patron inquiries were rude at best, and combative/offensive at worst. I do not deny that we complained about the conditions, perhaps that qualifies as "spoiled" in their estimation, but considering that we were paying good money for our stay I hardly find complaining of a lack of A/C in 40 degree Celsius weather "spoiled". If this flat dismissal of our requests were not enough, many rooms had water soaking the floors making the carpet wet and musty smelling, many of the showers lacked curtains spilling water on the tile floor and flooding the bathrooms making footing treacherous, water leaks along the ceiling causing peeling paint and mold growth with overpowering odor only barely sums up the inadequacies of the rooms themselves. In addition the elevator/lift broke with 5 of our tour members in it, forcing them to endure 43+ degree Celsius temperatures in a tiny space for at least 15 minutes. Upon their release from the elevator there was ZERO apology for or even acknowledgement from hotel management of thier ordeal. To top things off there was a late night visit from the Venician fire department for some undisclosed reason. When we asked why the fire department was there we were rudely told that it was "nothing". Perhaps things are done differently in Venice, but typically a visit from the Fire Department is not "nothing". Overall, our experience was profoundly negative and the conditions/staff hospitality were well below the expectations of even the most tolerant of travelers. No one could be expected to pay money for such treatment and conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Not better than 2 star.”
Reviews.Author: ed112927
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was out of service and , as usual for italy, no screens in the widows. I wound up sleeping in a chair in the lobby rather than the room. The elevator/lift was very small, which made it diffuclt to get to and from the rooms during check in/check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gaudibear21
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from St Marks Square, The hotel is compact, but in a good location, the room we had was on the 2nd floor and was extremley spacious, much bigger than expected, the room had high ceilings and a big window, with a distant view of the canal, the bed was comfortable, and the room had a big wardrobe, as you entered like a small foyer, a large and very well appointed bathroom, TV etc. The breakfast room was fairly compact, but the breakfasts were excellent, the downstairs reception area had a lovely aspect out onto the canal through the sliding door to a small deck. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and its fanstastic location, very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blmtct
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an execellent location right off of a small canal that you can water taxi to and you're just around the corner from St Marks Square and all the action. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel is nice, it's not the Bauer or the Danielle but nor are you paying those prices so keep that in mind. We had a clean large triple room on the 5th floor, overlooking the small canal leading to the hotel with 3 huge windows lovely views. Large bathroom with two sinks. Shower/tub was fine but keep in mind only 1/2 glass door so we tended to spray the floor alot as we showered. AC was ok wasn't as cold as we liked but we had AC. Other folks in our group at this hotel with us didn't have AC the first night so they weren't comfortable and changed their rooms. The biggest complaint about this hotel would be their elevator which is extremely slow so don't be in a hurry. We tended to use the stairs down and only take elevator up. Breakfast was very good with a variety of choices. Also, be aware if eating in the hotel restaurant for lunch or dinner you must let them know you're a hotel guest or you will pay a seat charge (as most restaurants charge in Venice) for sitting at their tables. Free internet available in the hotel lobby just ask front desk for the passcode.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent taste of Venice and location, location”
Reviews.Author: ajschubert1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early July with my husband, two daughters, mother and mother-in-law. Just around the corner to St. Mark's Square and to wonderful shops and restaurants. My mother has difficulty walking so location was everything. Took a water taxi to the hotel which was very nice and a nice welcome. Our rooms were big with high ceilings, bathrooms large,beds comfortable. Staff could not be more helpful. Located in a small canal with so much charm. Breakfast was adequate with good service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Brisbanetraveller91
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, the room was clean and neat, however there were holes in the wall beside the bed. The bathroom was a little cramped between the sink and toilet, however the shower was huge but it didn't drain well and flooded as soon as the water was turned on. The hotel was in a good location a stone's throw from St Mark's Square although it was a little hard to find but I guess that's Venice with all it's alleyways. The hotel's about a 10 minute walk from the Rialto vaporetto station which is only two stops from the main Ferrovia train station. The staff were mostly friendly and helpful and the breakfast had cereal, yoghurts, scrambled eggs, bread rolls and pastries. Ok hotel if you're only spending a night or two in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DetachedObserver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fairly poor condition. with extremely small rooms. We had asked for adjoining rooms as we were travelling with our grandson. The rooms offered were 30 feet apart, on opposite sides of the corridor, and round a corner. When I asked if they had anything that more closely met our needs, they showed us two rooms on the next floor that were even further apart. We found another hotel, and even though we spent no nights in the hotel, they insisted on charging us for two nights. The staff were generally unhelpful and uninterested. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: palakgupta
Reviews.Content: The good part- location is very nice, free internet, very friendly staff and decent breakfast. The bad- the rooms are anything great- very old, very thin walls, you can hear everything from the next room. bust just stayed there for a night so did not mind too much....

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: alan_clementson
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights as part of a tour group,small noisy room with the worst bed in Italy,bed was probably as old as the hotel. Breakfast was served in a room not suitable for the amount of people using it.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is expensive, but if you can afford a central location then this place is probably as good as any other, though I don't h”
Reviews.Author: Katelder
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite right up the top. No view(unless you count a brick wall) but lots of space and a welcome cake and bottle of prosecco. Be prepared for the bells of St Marks waking you at 7. Not a problem for us. Breakfast was pretty crap, so we didn't bother after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, shame about the bed”
Reviews.Author: Gordon6681
Reviews.Content: The location was great, my room was quite large, for a single room, big bathroom, but not 4 star, more like 3 star. Breakfast was very good, cooked and continental breakfast, eat as much as you can. Go to the rear of the hotel, stand on the hotels own jetty and watch the traffic on the canal, it was an amazing experience But the bed!! It was a 2` 6" bed, yes, 2` 6". It was difficult turning over, why not spend a few more Euros and buy a normal 3` bed. I would say it was a nice hotel, spotlessly clean, helpful staff, good breakfast but that bed, it spoilt my stay. Buy a 3` bed or larger, the room would take it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Venice at Carnival time”
Reviews.Author: moekd
Reviews.Content: We visited this Hotel on February 2010, for the Carnevale di Venezia. Hotel located right on Piazza San Marco. We had great fun watching a parade passing right under our hotel room window one afternoon. At night it was a bit noisy but we managed to get some sleep. Breakfast was not bad, hotel room was beautiful, price a bit high, but during carnival it was to be expected. All together - a good hotel can make a good vacation great; this one was the best hotel for it :) One comment - when visiting Venice, mind that the food is not very good. Somehow the wonderful Italian cuisine skipped Veniceâ€¦ Sadly, our best meals were at Pizza stands and at Burger King. But the Gelato was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location for a Quick Break!”
Reviews.Author: CLAREBG
Reviews.Content: Good Points: This hotel is in a extremely convenient location, the rooms are large although the decor is very dated. We had room 302 which had the most incredible view of the canal and a picturesque little balcony. The breakfast each day was yummy, there is a coffee machine, fruit juice, a large variety of cakes and pastries, cereal, yoghurt, rolls, cold meats and bacon and eggs - so hopefully something to suit everyone. The staff were lovely and smiley and very helpful and there was always someone at reception. There is a very good heater if you go in winter. Bad Points: The shower had quite low pressure, the hairdryer is quite bad, and the bed was too hard for me. Easy to get to once you find it! It is down a small lane with the restuarant also called All'Angelo on one corner and a bank (with convinient atm) on the other corner!!. From the Airport catch the Alilaguna (25 euro for a return ticket) Catch the Blue line to San Marco or San Zaccaria and wal

Reviews.Title: “Busy Venice. Wall to wall people.”
Reviews.Author: kerryandnoel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights after returning from a cruise. A little hard to find initially but what isn't in Venice. Right next to St. Mark's square, so very central. There are no doubt better, quieter rooms here but we didn't have one. The large window opened onto the back of another building and courtyard which was lit all night. The room was small once luggage is included. The breakfast was quite good, but was a little off-put to have our room key checked each morning to make sure we were guests. Staff were helpful without being over-friendly. Would recommend but with above precautions regarding room.

Reviews.Title: “The good & the bad....”
Reviews.Author: Chrishel
Reviews.Content: Visiting Venice for my wife's birthday; booked via a UK on-line travel company - picked the All Angelo for location & apparent value for central 4-star in Venice. I'ld made some pre-arrangements with the hotel via e-mail - these were carried out promptly & efficiently. Staff seemed friendly & helpful - this was borne out on arrival. The double room was on the small side, with not too many amenities. Whilst being clean it was in need of updating - bathroom was ok though no bath (just a shower). No foreign TV channels available (CNN, BBC World) just Italian - TV quality poor. Guests get 15% discount in the hotel restaurant & the sister pizza place across the road; this does help in Venice (at least a little). The All Angelo restaurant however is quite expensive - food is ok but overpriced for the quality; service is slow especially when busy. Be warned - the wine list is the SAME as in the pizza place but priced up about 3-5 euro a bottle !! The pizza place also give the 15% & is far better value for money. The main gripe would be the breakfast; not much choice - terrible coffee (out of a very slow dispensing machine) terrible fruit juice (also out of a dispensing machine); little food choice especially for hot food (bacon or scrambled eggs) - bread not fresh. As this hotel appears to accept tours (Globus, Cosmos to name two) breakfast gets verrrrry busy; the room is small & will NOT accept everybody at once so you end up waiting for a table; the furniture is also very old & the chairs uncomfortable. This needs sorting out; if this was somewhere else (Paris say) it would struggle for a 4-star rating - as its Venice, & for the money, I guess its gets away with it to a degree, Location is great - just a minute (literally) away from the Basilica. A value for money option - definitely! Nice hotel for relaxation & food - no!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our stay in Venice even more memorable!”
Reviews.Author: MarieGiaNelli
Reviews.Content: Location: situated in a road filled with Italian restaurants and shops, a couple of minutes away from the tourist heart of Venice, St. Marks's Square. One side of the hotel is facing a beautiful picturesue canal and has a private dock so that you can use gondolas directly from it. Our room was on the fourth floor and had a breathtaking view of the canal. That meant that even though we were in a busy area, there was no noise at all, just the occasional voices of the gondoliers. Service: we were very impressed with the staff! They were always eager to point out places on the map and give us directions, even make suggestions always keeping in mind our budget. The breakfast consisted of fruit, omelet, bacon, yogurt, cereal, cake, pastries, milk, juice,coffee. All in all very satisfactory. The hotel was very clean and our room was made daily. Advice: if you arrive by a water bus from the airport or the railway station, make sure you get off at St. Marks's Square and not the St. Zaccaria stop. The first one is closer to the hotel and there are no bridges that you need to cross in order to get to All'Angelo. Highlights: we started off our days by opening the window and taking in the magnificent view. When we returned tired from all the sightseeing, it was so comorting to know that we could dine right next to our hotel in one of the numerous restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with balconies on the canals”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugVA
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel could use a lot of updating, you cannot beat the location--near St. Mark's Square, which is why Globus Tours continues to use it. Our triple room was quite large with balcony views of the canals. The only problem was the heat. The management refused to turn on the air conditioning despite the unseasonally warm temperature. We managed to get a small fan for the room, which helped. The extra bed was not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures on internet are not true to what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Lari77
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice it was told to us it is a 3 minute walk from taxi boat. Actually 20 minutes to find. Location was the only good thing abou staying here. Since I prepaid I had no choice to stay the 2 nights. I checked all 3 rooms and imediately went to staff to tell them the pictures you post on internet is not near what the rooms look like. They explained to me of course not it was the suites on the internet. The bathroom and bedoom had cracks all down the walls, the bathroom had mold all around the tile that wasnt cracked. It was disgusting. The room smelled like mold and the aircondition was not working. They told me they will fix it while I was out. As I returned it was still broke. They offered me a fan and told me there was only a room for 2 available, I asked what do I do with my child. He did not know. He told me to keep windows open, yea so I can have bugs and the bats fly in. It was a horrible experience, The other room of 3 was worse yet. They had a shower that the water did not go down, it kept overflowing, the tubs hot water value was not working and the hotel man could not fix it. It too had musty smell and cracks down wall. The 3rd bed in each room was made to fit a 4 year old child. It was to small and mattress was thin as a board. I compained and they came to replace it with a thicker one that was bigger than the bed. Also the bathroom doors in all 3 rooms were broke, didnt close right, let alone lock. The 3rd room was just the same. I requested 2 single beds in that room and of course my family had to move furniture to seperate the beds. Also there bathroom was just the same as with the doors. I would NOT RECOMMEND this hotel.!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION AND WE LIKED THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Tjomsland
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here 2 nights while waiting to catch a cruise ship. The location is unbelievable. One building away from San Marco Square, Piazza San Marco. Wonderful restaurants and shopping and history within steps of the hotel. And, yes, it has an elevator. I recommend that you do not sleep with the windows open. Use the air-conditioning depending on the season. We slept with the windows open and I probably had about 30 mosquito bites the next day and it took a week before the bites were gone. The included breakfast actually had real breakfast food with a decent selection, variety and an espresso dispensing machine where you just push a button and it gives you your favorite espresso or macchiado or just plain coffee. You need to check out the bathroom pictures that I posted. A very lovely bathroom and shower. This is not even close to a five star hotel and is priced high, but the breakfast is a real breakfast and not donuts, etc. The location is everything. You could not ask for a better location. It is charming, clean and cozy. A short walk to everything. And, next to their restaurant is Ruferro's Restaurant at San Marco 417 and my wife said it was the best fish meal she has ever had. We ate there both nights. The All Angelo Restaurant was so busy that we couldn't get service and got up and left.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room, 70euro water-taxi to train station!”
Reviews.Author: Anilu77
Reviews.Content: 1. Is like 10 minutes if you are carrying luggage and is hard to find if you are not carrying a map. 2. The room is small, it smells damp and is not pretty 3. is not 4 stars at all, mayb 2 4. too expensive for what you get. Venice is very pretty in order to waist your time in this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a long weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Borden59
Reviews.Content: Tucked away quietly behind San Marco square and only 3 minutes walk from the San Marco waterbus stop. Good base for walking or waterbussing to all parts of town. Worth leaving the square behind in favour of less crowded and less expensive areas only a few minutes away. The hotel staff were terrific - especially in reception, at breakfast and in the bar. The latter has stylish decor, a good range of drinks and friendly service. Only weak point was breakfast - quantity OK but no fruit. Nice touch: hotel provides short daily news summaries in 4 languages for its international clientele.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with fantastic location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Latino_Loco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the All Angelo Hotel during our honeymoon in Venice. The room is very old and is not really up to our expectation for a 4 star hotel. The breakfast at the hotel was great with a variety of things to choose for. The staff was very polite and their service quality was ok. I like the location which is very convenient to St. Marc's Square where you can enjoy an evening stroll and free music from those pricey restaurants in the square. Overall, just a nice hotel with fantastic location.. however, don't expect what you would normally receive for a 4 star hotel at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend- Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ItalySW19
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the All'Angelo in Venice for three nights and went with no expectations as we previously read mixed reviews. The whole experience was very pleasant. Our room was comfortable, what you would expect from a 4 star and spotlessly clean. All the public areas are also very neat and tidy. Some previous reviews said this is not a 4 star hotel but for Venice, together with the location and the price it is. The only negative I can find was a very surly barman in their "HK Bar" which is part of the hotel- he was not very polite. We did not try their restaurants. Breakfast was of a very good standard. Next time we go back to Venice will definitely use this hotel again. They even have their own Private Water Taxi which at â‚¬80 is much cheaper than the ones at the airport or at points around town.

Reviews.Title: “Special Birthday”
Reviews.Author: SmilerDevon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel several times and always found it excellent value for money with a superb location. The restaurant though I wouldn't recommend ...definitely over rated and over priced, and in January not very warm. I pre booked the candle lit dinner which was advertised on their web site for my husbands 75th birthday........a complete disaster,,,candle lit????.........a tea light in a small glass!!!!!!!! we were given a table which was so small the waiter eventually brought an extension for it , the napkins were paper, and the cocktail which was on the special menu was served in a frosted tumbler not even a coctail glass and the main course was cold so I sent it back.........my side order arrived so late I'd finished my food. We were disgusted......the restaurant wasn't busy so there was no excuse and it was such a disappointment as it was meant to be a special dinner. When I complained we found a "Present" (their word ) of a custard and fruit tart with 2 glasses of sweet dessert wine in our room when we returned later in the day with a note which said they were sorry we were disappointed so please to accept the present to make amends!!!!!!Needless to say I was not impressed and asked for a reduction in the dinner price which was refused. I'll return to the hotel again......use the restaurant no chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Definately not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MaroKat
Reviews.Content: Great location (once we found it!). Very close to St Marks Square. Room was quiet. Not much of a view from the room we had and the room was quite small compared to other hotels we had stayed in in Italy, but clean. Andrea Bocelli was performing in the Square the night we arrived (we had no idea when we originally booked). For guests who were only staying one night, it would have been handy to have been told upon checking in. Disappointing, given we missed the concert altogether as a result.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pandaUK
Reviews.Content: Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. It is literally a couple of minutes from San Marco. It is very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good but I didn't try the restaurant. I didn't find the staff to be particularly friendly or helpful but their turnover of guests is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for staying near St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: quesochica
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Venice before so I wanted something closer to a main landmark so that I wouldn't get impossibly lost. I got impossibly lost anyway but that's the charm of Venice. As for the hotel, we had a very nice room. It was quite spacious. At certain times of day it could be a bit noisy on the alley below but that was the price I knew I would pay choosing a hotel so near the tourist district. The breakfast was fine. I was not so fond of the dinner we had in the restaurant hotel. It was too touristy and we did better with some of Rick Steve's suggestions in other neighborhoods. The front desk staff was helpful- especially as we had to check-out the morning of a vaporetto strike and they helped us find alternative transportation. Overall, it was a good hotel for the price and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a spot close to the square.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, Couldn't be better.Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: TillyLancs
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel and would definitely stay there again. The location is second to none, San Marco, Doges Palace are literally a couple of minutes away however we were not disturbed by street noise at night. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Our room was huge, 3 floor to ceiling windows which did actually open however the air conditioning was great. The bathroom was large and well appointed, clean towels every day. Both bedroom and toilet were cleaned daily, the bed made each morning and turned down at night, the maid even leaves some sweets on the bedside table! The breakfast was very good, cereals, fruit, cake, bacon, scrambled eggs, croissants, cake, jam and tea, coffee, hot chocolate and selection of fruit juice. I would highly recommend Foscarini Pizzieria, next to Academia Bridge, good value and the thinest pizzas in Venice, grab a table overlooking the canal if you can. Don't be put off coming to Venice by the high prices, there are lots of reasonable and good places to eat and drink, just take your time and look around. We booked with Hotel Connect and would recommend them to anyone, this is the 4th time we have booked with them and each time the hotels have been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: TheoTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotels in Venice's San Marco area are way overpriced, so when my wife and I found this hotel for around 100 Euros a night, we took it due to location and price. When arrived we were not expecting much because of the price, but we were pleasantly surprised; the staff was very good and thoughtful, the room was good and the bathroom was very nice. I have to say that the best surprise of all was the breakfast, which was included in the price; it had everything from pastries and coffee to muesli, yogurt, eggs and juice. For the money, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position, pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer009
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group, and were expecting the hotel to be old, which it is, but it was comfortable and clean, and as we weren't in the room except to sleep, we loved it. It's close to everything, and adds to the wonderful experience which is Venice. It was very hot when we were there, and despite what the manager says in another review, were told that the airconditioning isn't on until later in May. We had to open the windows, which opened onto the restaurant alleyway, which was noisy, then close them when we went to bed! We managed, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base from which to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller5000
Reviews.Content: The Albergo All'angelo offers surprisingly "reasonable" rates (by Venetian standards). The room was large and quiet, although the ensuite bathroom was exceptionally narrow, and some larger guests may find it difficult to even enter the 50cm or so wide doorway to it. Well positioned (once we finally found it) just behind St Mark's square, 1 block right of Macdonalds and up a lane behind restaurant All'angelo (St Mark's is well accessed by vaporetto around Venice (inc. to the station) and regular boats to the airport). Shopping, restaurants & tourist attractions aplenty surround the hotel. The nearby restaurants were for the most part unexciting (although we found an excellent Chinese cuisine one just over the adjacent bridges). The St.Mark's area was a good base for us and thus we chose this hotel based on area, price & recommendations from this site.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great hotel, lovely views”
Reviews.Author: SaraDonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in December 2007 for a birthday trip and it did not disappoint. It was right behind St Marks Square and our room was gorgeous, it was reasonably big and we had a stunning view out over a canal. It was very romantic and the location was excellent we were close to pretty much everything. The restaurant was aslo lovely, only complaint is that they do not understand the meaning of 'well done' when you are ordering a steak! Only a small complaint as everything else was fantastic. Would definitely stay here again, got it at a great price too when I booked it online.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around hotel”
Reviews.Author: cristinag1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. We were extremely pleased with this gem. It is a great location, right behind Saint Mark's Square, and a short walk to the Ponte Rialto and main shopping streets. The staff were extremely helpful and patient with our incessant questions, assisting us with setting up a visit to Murano and in getting to the airport. Our room was fantastic--huge, with a gorgeous marble bathroom, and large dressing area. The hotel was very clean as well. There are several restaurants and bars that are in and next to the hotel, for which we were offered discounts to eat there. The breakfast was good and included eggs, breakfast meats, sandwich meats, rolls, pastries, cereal, and yogurt. We heard the bells of Saint Mark's but that was part of the charm!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: RugbyBabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over Christmas, and loved it. ok the view from our window was a wall across a narrow street, but we werent in the room that much! Breakfast was great, the staff were friendly and helpful. You really cant get a better location! right behind St Marks. Though this does mean you get the bells first thing in a morning, although am sure that you can hear bells where ever you are in Venice! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for a perfect wedding day”
Reviews.Author: PollyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to say a big thankyou to all the staff at All' Angelo restaurant after spending our wedding reception there. We were nervous about booking a restaurant we hadnt seen before, but the meal, drinks, and most of all, the staff present to look after us were fabulous. Made the most important day of our lives just perfect! The meal was so impressive some of our guests went back later in the week for another meal. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good food and friendly staff. Thankyou again All Angelo's!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city terrible view”
Reviews.Author: tiger077
Reviews.Content: This was the first and worst hotel room in our tour of Italy. Hotel in general ok breakfast ok. Restaurant attatched to hotel very good. Situation of hotel very good. The room however was terrible the view was just a brick wall 2 metres from the window, making it very dark. The air con was broken down so they had installed a huge noisy portable unit with a large pipe that hung out of the window. as it was therefore not possible to close the window, at midnight you got the bells of the church and half an hour later all the metal window shuters clashing down followed by various revellers shouting throughout the night! It was perhaps just as well the window could not be shut as the smell from the bath plug outlet was shocking! We asked the porter on arrival in this room if there were any other rooms available but he just grabbed the tip and ran out the door!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitzy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the All Angelo in July for 3 nights. It was a fantastic hotel with wonderful staff who were exceptionally helpful throughout our stay. Had a nice large room with a canal view. The restaurant which is part of the hotel was fantastic too. It's location to St. Mark's Square was ideal. I would definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthIslandKiwis
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff were very friendly. We had a lovely room with a view over a canal. The breakfast was fantastic with a good variety. Excellent location at the back of San Marco Piazza. We would go back again and recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BerkoBoy88
Reviews.Content: Decided to take my wife for her birthday weekend to Venice. I had some accumulated points on a credit card so I booked through Hotelopia. I requested a canal view as it was a birthday treat. This was totally ignored. In fact we were not even in the main hotel. We were given a second floor apartment in a separate building a few paces away from the hotel. It was very large and would have slept six people. The beds were clean and comfortable. There was an apology for a television in the bedroom which only received local Italian TV. The picture was appalling. I would have expected a good picture and some international TV for a centrally located hotel. There was a large lounge with a bed/settee and plenty of wardrobe space. Sadly , there were no tea or coffee making facilities or even a kettle. They obviously wanted us to spend money on their expensive cold refreshments in the well stocked fridge. The bathroom was adequate but the bath and shower were a joke. Fortunately we are both agile but the very slim bath had no grab handles and would in our opinion, have been dangerous for anyone who was large and less agile. The shower never turned off and always sprayed water even when turned to bath. It was hand-held only and one was thus unable to have a proper shower. The toilet continually ran with water, not a problem for us as we couldnâ€™t hear it but what a waste of resources. The cabinet was well stocked with shampoo, soap and shower caps (hardly necessary) and the towels were plentiful. Overall the bathroom needs a makeover. Breakfast was across the passageway in the main hotel. It was adequate but the same every day. The only warm food was bacon and scrambled eggs. There were cold meats and cakes plus juices and tea and coffee. Amazingly no toast of any description only rolls. The staffs were helpful and informative. Another point of warning. Donâ€™t put on too many lights as the fuse kept tripping out. It happened twice and I called for assistance on the first occasion to locate the fuse box. A few seconds later it happened again. I soon worked out the apartment didnâ€™t like all its lights left on a once. The electrical wiring also needs a makeover. As the room was effectively free I canâ€™t complain too much. I would however have been mightily disappointed if I had paid the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: The_But2ns
Reviews.Content: We have just returned today from a 3 night stay at this hotel - there were a group of us - and we did have 2 single travellers - one of which stayed in room 204!! (see other review) The hotel is in a perfect location, a stones throw from St Marks, and it has it's own pier - which makes your arrival in Venice that much more special. You can get to anywhere from here really easily, breakfast is adequate to see you off on a day's sightseeing, the rooms are a good size and very clean and the housekeeping is very efficient. Above everything else though - what makes this hotel outstanding in our opinion - is the staff! - particularly the reception staff - Absolutely nothing was too much trouble, a simple question and they would go out of their way to find you all the relevent information, ring restaurants, draw maps - print off timetables- anything - really really superb! We all had a wonderful time in Venice - such a fantastic place, and the All Angelo was no small part of that experience - Well Done - keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: Mtl-travelers
Reviews.Content: Part of the Globus tour package. Being in Venice, I expected to be cramped in a small room...what a nice surprise! Not only is it literally a few steps away from St-Mark square, our room was a good size and with a great view! We were on the top floor and had a great view of the bell tower and the dome of the St-Mark square. The staff spoke perfect english and friendly! Our other travel companions had nothing bad to say about their rooms neither...No chance of not finding your way back to your hotel if you get lost in the streets in Venice..just ask for direction back to St-Mark's square. There are 2 restaurants, as a guest of the hotel, you can ask the reception for a discount voucher of 15% to any of their restaurants...One of the restaurant is actually Hell's Kitchen...(very Pricey). So we decided to go for the other. it was actually quite decent. Do remember that you are in Venice, great food is hard to find and it is quite expensive (more than the rest of Italy)..so do your research...

Reviews.Title: “not very 'angelic'”
Reviews.Author: ashlea
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Venice and was rather disappointed with this hotel. I got a good rate (5 nights for 4) but as quite often with being a single traveller drew the short straw with my room. The hotel has been refurbished ,the staff helpful and pleasant and the room itself was a fair size and well furnished ,with a smart bathroom with a roomy shower BUT it looked out onto a flat roof where the fans and vent for the restaurant kitchen discharged.From early evening until the early hours the room smelt of cooking and the fans were noisy.This being May and not warm(by Venetian standards) altho'the temperature was around 75 degrees the air con doesn't get switched on until later in the month and the room was hot and stuffy as opening the windows didn't help and made the fan/food situation worse.Also the housekeeping staff room was at right angles to the room and unless the inner curtains were drawn when the lights were on, maids etc could see into the room. A decent nights sleep was impossible.I should think most of the other rooms were acceptable but for a single traveller beware and if you are given room 204 PROTEST !! Also avoid the restaurant-mediocre food and high prices.Plenty of other places to eat in the area.Perhaps I expect too much but for years have been sick of being fobbed off with rotten rooms and being charged extra for the 'privilege'

Reviews.Title: “Location and surprise upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Anne4066
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a Globus tour of Italy so we had no choice. We really loved this place. The location was perfect and the staff was friendly. The best part was we were given an upgrade to Suite 140. We opened the door to find a large sitting room and a balcony overlooking two canals. It stepped up to a huge bedroom with a king bed, large antique furniture and 2 more big windows. Off of the bedroom were 2 bathrooms! Even without the uprgrade all of the other peoples rooms were also roomy and nice. This hotel definitely gets a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at All'Angelo”
Reviews.Author: Gail11111
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at Hotel All'Angelo. We had a superb huge room for 3 people on the 4th floor with 1 single bed downstairs and stairs to a mezzanine containing a double bed. As a family room it had all we needed i.e being all together in one room but also giving that bit of privacy by having the room split. There was a lovely view down one of the canals which meant you could sit in the evening after a busy day of walking and sight seeing and just relax and look out of the window to see the gondaliers going too and fro. Room was very clean and as well as being made up each morning it was also checked late afternoon/early evening to have the beds turned down. Bathroom was also huge with bath, shower and two wash basins. Lovely breakfast and staff friendly. Fantastic location, just out of hotel door and you are straight into one of the side streets leading into St Mark's Square where there are numerous restaurants and more shops then anyone could want. Very near to the water bus for trip to and from the Airport. Based on our experience we would certainly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: tedetoy
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, on a canal yet close to St. Marks Square. Room clean, comfortable with small sitting room and very large bath. Not all rooms easy to get to, requires elevator and walking up steps, but the inconvienence worth it. Staff friendly and willing to please, very helpful. A definate would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: emmac1980
Reviews.Content: Having received numerous reports that Venetian hotels are exepnsive and the quality diminshes the closer you get to St Mark's square, we were apprehensive when booking to stay at the All'Angleo, howveer the offer from Easyjet through hotelopia was too good to miss and we manged to pay a good price for 4 nights accomodation. Upon arrival on the Alilaguna we wandered through St Mark's Square and, after a few minor hiccups, found the hotel which was only a 3minute walk away, with no bridges to manouvere with our suitcases. The foyer is quite impressive and the reception staff were extremely helpful throughout our stay. Our room was very spacious and the bathroom was well equipped, albeit the decor was slightly dated, we were located on the 5th floor (there is a lift) and had a stunning view over the tops of Venice and the canal to the rear of the hotel, for the price our accomodation was fantastic. Breakast was served until 10.30am and, for a small room, there were always clean tables and the buffet choice was fab including, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, cakes, meats, bacon and scrambled eggs! As a guest you receive 15% discount when eating in one of the 3 hotel restaurants which we did on the 1st evening, however this discount was pointless as they charge 3.50 euros per person cover charge and a 12% service chaarge, and for a pizza it turned out to be one of the more expensive meals during our stay, however on the main street near to the hotel there are restaurants that don't charge cover or sevice and the food is of a good standard, especially the one located next door to MacDonalds (which looks slightly drab from the outside). Note, one vening we decided to treat ourselves and ate at one of the restaurnats on the Grand Canal next to the Rialto Bridge as the prices appeared quite reasonable, but the staff were rude, the food was mediocre and it turned out to be pretty expensive, stick to the small streets and the food can be quite reasonable. Overall we had a fantastic stay in venice and, if location is important, the All'Angelo cannot be beaten!

Reviews.Title: “short family break”
Reviews.Author: strumble
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from at 3 night stay at the All Angelo.My party had 3 rooms - 2 single rooms and a twin/double (standard). We chose the location based on location and cost. Since we did not intend to spend much time in the hotel we were not particularly interesed in having lots of facilities.I do expect a warm and clean room. Fortunately we chose well and were pleased with our decision. The 2 single rooms were small but had all that was needed for a short stay.Room 405 does not have an in room safe as their website indicated but the other two did. I was told I could use the lobby safe.This room also had no hotel information guide /welcome booklet! As I was travelling with family in other rooms I was able to look at theirs- had I been on my own I might have thought that none of the rooms have such a guide. As the hotel has a restaurant attached there is a huge choice of room service food should you want it ! Who would with so many nice trattorias a few second walk away? The hotel lay out is eccentric to say the least many turns and unexpected stairs .This makes it interesting but confusing! I was still getting lost after 2 days!! Reception were helpful - both single rooms only had one flat pillow so we requested another which appeared quickly. Beds were hard but not the worst I've ever been in. Both single rooms had lovely shower rooms recently renovated. The double room had an mixed look - new heated towel rail but old tiles, some cracked. There were notices around apologising for problems caused by the hotel improvements. We did not see any evidence of mess anywhere or hear any noise.Our rooms were all on different floors so I would have noticed. In fact this hotel was very quiet- bells can be heard from the Bell Tower on St Marks and woke me up at 7 am. Weren't bothered during the night. Maybe they stop then. One thing we didn't like was the noise in room 204, one of the singles. There is some sort of conditioning unit nearby and did keep my mum awake. This room also has NO view whatsoever except into a tiny dark courtyard/shaft . Breakfast was good considering this is not a 4 star hotel- fresh fruit, yoghurt, bread, cakes ,eggs(boiled and scrambled) undercooked bacon,ham, cereals etc. No excuse for going hungry.Finding the hotel is not too difficult.It is easy to find from St Mark's square.Face the Cathedral, take the street on the left, go past the little lions , keep going until you reach the last alleyway before the Canonica bridge, On the GROUND is a blue plaque that says Pauly & C. Furnace.The road is called Ramo va in Canonica.Go straight down this for about 30 metres and the hotel is on the left. Sign above says Albergo All Angelo. All in all a greatt find for a budget stay in a FAB location.We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Venice”
Reviews.Author: DarLyn24
Reviews.Content: The All'Angelo is excellent value for money, and superbly located less than a one minute walk from St Mark's Basilica. The hotel was extremely clean, the staff were friendly, breakfast was the nicest we have had in a European hotel and the room was large, comfortable, warm and appeared to have been recently re-decorated. By Venice standards, the hotel was also easy to find. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: NPro
Reviews.Content: I can't fault the location of this hotel as it is perfect, right on St Mark's Square. It is a 4 star hotel but i would say more like a 2/3 star. The room was tiny but clean but the noise from other rooms was quite loud! It was advertised to have WiFi in the rooms which suited us as we needed to use the laptop from time to time but when we arrived it was down and we could not log on and when we asked at reception we were told it was down and that there was an internet cafe around the corner! Which i felt was a bit cheeky as all we needed to do was check in for our flight, they did not offer to do it for us and we had to pay nearly 8 euro to have 15 mins in the cafe! I know im being picky but for the price of the hotel i think they could have helped us out! Breakfast was perfect buffet and filled us up till lunch. Overall the city of Venice is a favourite of ours now and would reccommend it to any couple looking for a romantic break. But 2/3 days is plenty as the crowds everywhere are crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Oh what a view!!”
Reviews.Author: gdarcy57
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel just loved the setting great staff, smack in the middle of everything. just steps from st marks square. When we got to our room I opened the shutters and what a view right down a canal it was something off a post card. can't wait to go back soon!!! G.Darcy ny new york

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura Nelson
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was also very large and well appointed. Great location once I finally found the hotel. The staff was helpful and pleasant. I would stay there again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice...”
Reviews.Author: slynes
Reviews.Content: It is such a lottery when you book a hotel but we won a jackpot with this one. The hotel's location is its greatest strength. It is right in the centre of the San Marco district and within a few yards of the main transport network yet up its quiet alleyway, it was peaceful as well as convenient. Many top tourist sights like the Basilica, Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs were on the doorstep and the Rialto was only a meander away too. Staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable and the bathrooms excellent. The breakfast buffet was particularly good. Decent bars and cafes can be found nearby and lots of shopping opportunities too. Orchestras play all evening in the open air in St Mark's Square just a 2 minute stroll away. The hotel has a private landing stage and will book you a private airport transfer at very favourable rates. It was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the horrible memories”
Reviews.Author: I've_seen_it_all
Reviews.Content: The reason I am writing my review now is because I wasnâ€™t aware of Trip Advisor at the time. We are in the process of booking a hotel for our upcoming travels and will definitely not stay here again. We stayed at Hotel All'Angelo June 27 â€“ 29, 2006 and hated it! The minute we checked in the desk staff stood around talking and joking with each other while my husband and I stood there carrying many heavy bags. They ignored us for some time. Eventually they started to check us in. I asked to see the room first before handing my credit card over and the staff person rolled his eyes and sighed heavily. He yelled, â€œYou already paid,â€� as if to say we will get what they give us and we canâ€™t change anything now. He showed me a room that had its windows open because a huge air vent, the diameter of a large watermelon, was running from a floor air conditioner out through the window. The room was full of mosquitoes and had 2 single beds on either. The bathroom/shower looked like someone had died in it. Needless to say, I requested another room. The staff member rolled his eyes again and told me, â€œThat is all you can have here!â€� I think he expected me to just give in but I was celebrating our 21st Anniversary and was in no mood to take a room full of mosquitoes (because the window had to be kept open) and 2 single beds at either end of this odd shaped room. We finally were given a room that was small, dull and a bit depressing but at this point we were exhausted from our long flight, dragging luggage and being treated so poorly that we just checked in. We had a limited time in Venice and didnâ€™t want to spend it looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScarletBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the All'Angelo Hotal in September 2006 and it was absolutely magical. The air conditioning in our room was fantastic, the staff were very good and there is a water taxi provided which is much cheaper than the standard water taxi fares so this is worth bearing in mind when you are travelling to and from the station with your lugguage. The hotel's location couldn't be better, I woke up several mornings in a row at 06:00 and strolled down to St Mark's Square, literally around the corner. At this time of day the Square is just "waking up" and so one day I saw a bride in her wedding dress having her photograph taken with a deserted St Mark's Square as a backdrop and on another day the early morning mist hung over the lagoon like a scene from an art-house movie. You would not get a chance to see such things from any other location. Venice is stunning and this gem of a hotel made our stay something very special indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NinaLunaTella
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location! the staff also was very, very friendly and helpfull, and we loved the food in the hotel's restaurant. We were only steps away from san marco square. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,Awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: helmetgov
Reviews.Content: Went in mid May, our guide hooked us up as honeymooners to probably the best room. The front desk was wonderful,the rooms were very clean, and the location to St. Marks was steps away. Planning my next trip to include Hotel All Angelo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Benissimo!”
Reviews.Author: makoligirl
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Northern Italy in January 2007 where we celebrated our honeymoon. Our first stop was the charming and unique city of Venice. Finding the All' Angelo Hotel from the Rialto Vapereto stop was not that difficult, though it was quite a walk through the side streets/alley ways. We had a lot of luggage & on our check out date, we took a water taxi (was worth it & expensive) to the train station. Our room was small and located by the side street. The noise on the streets did not bother us, by if you prefer silence, you might want to request for another room. The appearance of our room was okay, furniture was old & it definitely needed a new bed and firmer pillows. Though our bathroom was great and it appeared to have been newly renovated with great fixtures & marble tiles. During our stay, there was construction but it did not bother us because we did not hear any noise. The complimentary breakfast was good. It's very European, cold cuts, bread, eggs, cereal, pastries, etc. --it's not the All American Breakfast Slammer. We specifically loved the location because we were close to Piazza San Marco. The off season rates were very affordable & it was definitely worth it because we had the best location.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jlboston
Reviews.Content: We had to ask a couple of local folks to find the hotel in a typical back alley, but that was it. The hotel is very close to San Marco and the room is much better than we expected. The bathroom is roomy and well equipped. The off-season 70 euros room rate was hard to beat. By the way, the room was pleasanty decorated with paintings. The only minor annoyance was a small number of mosquitos (in december!) that invaded the room when we opened the bathroom window to get some fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barbiegirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having found a great deal on Expedia for our Christmas present trip to Venice in January 2006. The hotel was prefectly situated just off San Marco and an ideal base for sightseeing. The room was reasonably sized and served us well, although it could have done with some upgrading - especially the very 70's looking red tiled bathroom but it was clean and tidy which is all you need. The hotel has 3 restaurants associated with it and we tried two of them using our guest discount vouchers. The hotel is perfect for a short stay for a sightseeing visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: S D Evs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Venice and we were very impressed with the overall standard of the All'Angelo. The room, 501, was very nice with a large bathroom and a superb shower. It was clean and looked after very well by the room service staff. We do think that the reception staff could be a little more helpful and cheerfull but this is only a minor matter. There is some re-furbishment taking place but we were never bothered by it. The hotel is in a great location for seeing all that you want in this magical place, we will certainly return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - superb location”
Reviews.Author: Pitnic
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews but hotel was great. Very clean and efficient. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful with excellent English. Location perfect. Glad we stayed here as arriving late at night for our first visit it was extremely easy to find. Breakfast buffet is very high standard too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rouxblom
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, around the corner from San Marco, friendly staff, VERY CLEAN and spacious room with wonderful view over a delightful canal. Everyone warned me about Venetian hotels, but this one was stunning. Breakfast was nothing to write home about, but you eat so well the other times, its hardly a problem. I don't think it is possible to get better value in Venice - in fact, you would not get it in UK, even rural areas. I could not fault them. It was a pleasure staying there and I would definetely return there. We stayed in Room 508!

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Tycochphil
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights November 06. The renovations continue though did not affect us. We had a lovely big room with a sitting room but we were just lucky as our friends' rooms were 'normal'. Higher is better I would say so try to get to 5th floor. We had no problem with any of the staff including the restaurant. We thought the prices in the restaurant were very good by Venetian standards 16 euro for a 3 course tourist meal with 15% discount for residents. i thought the breakfasts were good with bacon and scrambled eggs as well as cold meats, cereals and cheese. Location excellent for St Marc's sq, easy to find and convenient when taking suitcases to the waterbus stop to return home.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: PinkTraveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right off Piazza S. Marco, couldnt believe how close we were to everything. Unlike other reviews we found the staff to be charming and helpful providing chocolats and Prosecco on arrival. Breakfast was above average and the hotel was clean and maid service excellent. Would reccommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have Venice on your doorstep - well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, currently being renovated!”
Reviews.Author: antifuse
Reviews.Content: The All'Angelo is perfectly located. It is literally a 2 minute walk from St Mark's Square, and we got a fantastic deal on the room (100 euro a night) from Venere.com. However, it was under renovations when we stayed there, so our room was... less than optimal. The air conditioning hadn't yet been connected, so to compensate for it, they gave us one of those stand-up room air condtioners, but we had to leave the window open because the vent had to go somewhere. Not the most ideal situation, security wise, especially since the room had no safe. The moldings around the door had been removed at some point during renovations, and never replaced. It didn't feel particularly clean, but this could have been due to the renovations going on right outside the door. After seeing the room, we went down and complained. We were shown an apartment across the lane, which was also owned by the hotel, and was HUGE. It could easily have slept 5 people comfortably. It had central air conditioning and a nice big bed in the main bedroom. Definitely an improvement over our original room, and it was incredibly clean and the central air conditioning kept it icy cool during the serious Venice heat. For the same price, I couldn't complain any more. Absolutely perfect. I just wish I had noticed the shutters outside the window on the first night! They definitely helped shut out some of the noise from the restaurant down the alley, as well as keeping out the light in the morning. Breakfast was your typical continental breakfast - rolls, ham, cheese, cold cereal, juice, tea, and coffee. Some sweets if you're so inclined. All in all, I think the All'Angelo will be fantastic once they finish renovating. If you can get into one of the apartments, do so, it's much better than the typical (for Europe) small rooms of the main hotel. The staff at the desk was incredibly helpful, if a bit brusque, and the hotel (well, our apartment anyway) was clean, mostly quiet, and ideally situated. For the price? You could definitely do WAY worse. I would consider staying here again, provided the renovations are completed by that time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Guipa
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel itÂ´s like a 4 star hotel. The hotel was renovated and very well located. The unique problem is the restaurant, itÂ´s a little bit expensive compare with other of the same quality.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Dog”
Reviews.Author: Seeit
Reviews.Content: Well the location of the Hotel is great, anything to do with the hotel itself was TERRIBLE. Wires were hanging from the ceilings of the hallway...bed was like sleeping on the floor....room was extremely small.....all faucets in the bathroom leaked. Your shower couldn't have been larger than 2' X2'. But the worst part was the service at the front desk. Just plain RUDE and not helpful at all. Venice was the last stop on our vacation and while I was not expecting a large room in a three star hotel it was certainly disappointing to have stayed in such a poorly run facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karyaneka
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and thought this was a great hotel, not luxurious but simple, very clean and above all, centrally located. Staff were helpful and polite too. The hotel has a couple of restaurants and as a guest you get a 15% discount. If you are looking for a nice comfortable unpretentious base for exploring Venice then this is the hotel for you. Oh, and the room we had was large with a lovely bathroom (shower and bath) and a bidet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on a quick trip through Venice. It is a beautiful hotel, and very well located- just off Piazza San Marco. Location is important in Venice as you can end up being far away fmro the attractions, or having to take a water taxi back to your hotel if you are on the wrong island, and cheaper ones tend to be far away. But this hotel is right in the centre of it all. We only paid 65 euro for the room for the night, which was a fantastic price, though it may have only been temporarily cheaper because they were renovating at the time (this didn't interfere with our trip at all). Positives: *Fantastic location, easy to walk to everthing that you might want to see, but down a side lane so you're not in a swarm of people on a main strip as soon as you step outside (though we were there in winter, it will be busier in summer!). The furthest place to walk to is the train station (which isn't in a nice area so that is not a bad thing). *Large rooms wiht a big desk and a huge bathroom *Very well cleaned *Bathroom is large with a bath, and also bidet if that's your sort of thing. *Comfortable beds give you a good night of sleep *Excellent service- porters to take up your bag, and the gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and very helpful with booking tours and recommending activities. *There is a restaurant attached in a little grotto that does excellent pizzas, and you get a discount if staying in the hotel. *Heaps of other restaurants, cafes, and shops nearby, and the tourist centre is just on the other side of Piazza San Marco *Good breakfast- there is a variety of breads, pastries, cakes, cereal, cold meats, and juices and coffee. Not so good: *The walls are a bit thin so I could hear the couple next door arguing, but I didn't get woken up from sleep at all so it wasn't too bad! This is an excellent hotel in terms of service, access to tourist attractions and eateries, and aesthetic. It would suit most travellers. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: italytravelers
