Reviews.Content: We found a very low rate of 65 Euros for this hotel which is rated 3 stars in Italy. It is a great location, near San Marco, but off the main square so it is very quiet. We requested a room with a view and we were on the 3rd floor with our window opening over a small canal. The room was quite large for Italian standards. There was a TV that worked and had 3 stations in english, one in german, one in french and the rest of course in italian. The staff were all very friendly and as attentive as italians can be. The bathroom was very large and very clean, but bring your own hairdryer! The breakfast (included) was great, much more offered than the typical italian breakfast. I once stayed at a 4 star Best Western nearby and All'Angelo was much nicer. We did not try any of their restaurants. To compare, rooms in Italy are usually the size of a closet and bathrooms are not much to be excited about as well as any breakfast that might be included (e.g. toast). All'Angelo was great, large and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Central but....”
Reviews.Author: uamnome
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is centrally located, but that is about its only positive feature. Staff were quite indifferent. Breakfast was minimal and included canned fruit cocktail. The worst part, though, was the tiny room with a bed only slightly larger than single which we were given, even though we had paid the highest rate on their rate card. They explained there was nothing to be done about it. My husband and I had three sleepless nights on a too soft mattress in this tiny bed. The shower was intermitently boiling hot and icy cold. Further, we were both covered with insect bites from something that was in the room which we were never able to identify, although the room was loaded with mosquitoes. I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value! Great position”
Reviews.Author: hellyg35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and could not have asked for a better hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is brilliantly situated, if a little difficult to find at first. It is within easy walking distance of St Mark's Square, The Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs as well as easy access to the Rialto Bridge. We had a huge room with a view of one of the canals, and breakfast was inclued. At first I was worried having read a previous review, but I needn't have been. We couldn't have asked for a better location or a better value hotel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Dinner”
Reviews.Author: Paulsiebold
Reviews.Content: On a Globus Tour and had an excursion dinner here. The food was terrible. Veal was tough. Salmon was dry. Wine was rancid. Best to eat outside of this hotel. Or better yet, based upon some of the other reviews...don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and a nice room too.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireDiscerning
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the rather negative reviews about this hotel just prior to our departure, we were very pleasantly surprised when we actually arrived. Although arriving much later than expected because of flight delays we received a very warm greeting from the reception staff. They were wonderful throughout - polite, friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them - and this went for every member of the hotel's staff we met during our six-day stay. Service was as good as I have come across in my extensive travels - it certainly equalled, indeed exceeded the quality of service I have experienced in my Stateside travels - it was certainly more authentic. Our room was large, comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was simple but good. Location is excellent. The hotel water taxi is substantially cheaper and is worth using. All-in-all, we made a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel in a magical city.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having dreamed for years of visiting Venice, I finally treated my daughter and me to a four day trip this March. This hotel is perfect. You couldn't be more central unless you stayed in the Doge's Palace! A lovely clean room and superb bathroom with a magical view over a canal. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful.....and if you try a little italian it pays dividends. Breakfast was included in the price and was good and plentiful. We got caught in a very heavy snowfall....quite unusual for Venice...and the staff were very good at sorting out an alternative flight and putting the hotel's water taxi at our disposal to take us straight to the airport. I thank all the staff for making my dream trip so memorable. I highly recommend Venice and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back....”
Reviews.Author: Tier1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the All'Angelo hotel on a Globus tour. From our experience the hotel had some positives and some negatives. On the plus side, the location is just off St. Marks square and is in the heart of the area that most visitors want to be. Additionally , the room was the largest of the 8 hotels we stayed in with a very large bathroom and pleasantly decorated.. However, others in our group were very unhappy with their rooms saying that the showerheads fell off, etc. On the negative side, there was very little airconditioning in the rooms and we had to open the door to the hallway ...which was cooler than our room. Many people in the tour had no air and were given fans by the front desk. Also , the breakfast that was served was the poorest we encountered in Italy with canned fruit and a very limited selection. Interestingly, the hotel has no lobby-only a front desk area and when our 30 year old son came to join us for dinner , he wasn't allowed to come up to our room even though I asked the front desk to send him up as his mother wasn't quite ready. I was told by the front desk that "no one other than registered guests may go up to a room"....this was certainly the first time I had encountered this policy in over 50 years of traveling. All in all, I probably would not stay in this hotel again if there were other options available.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the All' Angelo for 5 fantastic nights. February was a bit chilly, but we were prepared for the weather. Excellent location, superb service from the staff, and half of the fun is the way that the hotel is laid out. It seems it was originaly two or three seperate places that have been combined. Up stairs, round halls, along corridors, marvellous. Restaurants were superb, both the Grotto and Main Dining area. Rooms were large, nicely decorated, and superbly appointed. I will go back the the All' Angelo, and don't hesitate to recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed ther June 30th to July 2 for 2 nights. Positives: 1. Location is excellent! 2. Breakfast as good. 3. Bathroom was big. Negatives: 1. The AC in our room didnt work and we were in Venice during a very hot time. So our room was almost 90 degrees. When we complained they couldnt do anything because the hotel was booked. So they said. 2. There was water leaking down our walls from the room above. Never really got a good answer as to why?! 3. The pillows were wet! No, not from the water from above but from the moisture in the room from the heat!! We had to ask to get new pillows!! Bottom line: I stayed here because of all the rave reviews but unfortunately we got a crappy room. Not very fun sightseeing all day to come back to a room that is 90 degrees!! Im not kidding! WE could barely sleep and the manager was not very sympathetic. Most of the hotels in Italy dont seem to care about their guests very much anyways! I guess customer service is an American idea! Would never stay there again! Stayed at much nicer hotels in Rome and Siena for less money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: monica1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, small but very clean rooms, helpful staff, nice breakfast.......would definately stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: All'Angelo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 403, 30124 Venice, Italy
